page.title: 01NORTH EAST HARLOW, 1985.
page.content: We live in the north east area of {Harlow,Essex.}The railway makes a border between the housing area and farmland. There are factories lining each side of the railway. To the north we are bordered by farmland,on the east by{Old Harlow},on the south by housing, and on the west by housing and farmland,with the railway in between. In{Templefields}we have the ruin of a Roman temple.{Old Harlow was {a village before the New Town was {built for housing after the Second {World War.}Harlow has 2 sportcentres,a swimming pool and a hospital. The Town Park is famous for its original layout. Although we live in a densely populated area,everywhere you look there is greenery and open space; we can easily reach London,the coast and the countryside.
